questions.question: What is Natural Language Processing (NLP)?

options.A: A branch of AI focused on enabling computers to understand and process human language
options.B: A programming language for artificial intelligence
options.C: A method for processing numerical data
options.D: A system for storing text documents

questions.question: What is the purpose of word embeddings in NLP?

options.B: To represent words as dense vectors in a continuous vector space, capturing semantic relationships

questions.question: What is the role of attention mechanisms in modern NLP?

options.B: To help models focus on relevant parts of input sequences when processing language

questions.question: What is BERT?

options.B: A bidirectional transformer model pre-trained on large text corpora

questions.question: What is the purpose of named entity recognition (NER)?

options.A: To identify and classify named entities like person names, organizations, locations in text
options.B: To count words in a document

questions.question: What is the main challenge in natural language understanding?

options.B: Dealing with ambiguity, context-dependence, and the complexity of human language

questions.question: What is the purpose of text summarization in NLP?

options.A: To count words in a document
options.B: To automatically generate shorter versions of text while preserving key information

questions.question: What is the role of language models in NLP?

options.B: To predict the probability of sequences of words and generate human-like text

questions.question: What is the purpose of sentiment analysis?

options.A: To determine the emotional tone or opinion expressed in text
options.B: To count words in a document

questions.question: What is the role of machine translation in NLP?

options.B: To automatically translate text from one language to another

questions.question: What is the purpose of text classification in NLP?

options.A: To categorize text documents into predefined classes or categories
options.B: To format text

questions.question: What is the role of preprocessing in NLP?

options.B: To clean and standardize text data for better processing (tokenization, normalization, etc.)

questions.question: What is the purpose of question answering systems in NLP?

options.A: To automatically understand and answer questions posed in natural language
options.B: To store questions

questions.question: What is the role of transfer learning in NLP?

options.B: To use knowledge learned from one task to improve performance on another related task

questions.question: What is the purpose of text generation in NLP?

options.A: To automatically create human-like text based on input or prompts
options.B: To store text

questions.question: What are the ethical considerations in NLP?

options.B: Bias in language models, privacy concerns, misuse of technology, and fairness

questions.question: What is the role of dialogue systems in NLP?

options.A: To enable natural language interaction between humans and computers
options.B: To store conversations

questions.question: What is the purpose of information extraction in NLP?

options.A: To automatically extract structured information from unstructured text
options.B: To store data

questions.question: What is the role of evaluation metrics in NLP?

options.B: To measure and compare the performance of NLP models and systems

questions.question: What are the key challenges in multilingual NLP?

options.B: Handling different language structures, scripts, and cultural contexts
